Specific Details: Presentation to Joint Oireachtas Commitee on Housing, Planning and Local Government
DPOs Lobbied: Maria Bailey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Pat Casey|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Presentation to Joint Oireachtas Commitee on Housing, Planning and Local Government
Intended Results: Presentation on the topic of the Construction Industry Register Ireland (CIRI). CIRI is an official online register, supported by Government, of competent builders, contractors, specialist sub-contractors and tradespersons who undertake to carry out construction works. The discussion was about putting CIRI on a statutory basis.
Lobbying Activities: The meeting of the Committee took place on 4 October.   Maria Bailey TD is Chair of this Committee. Pat Casey TD is Vice Chair.   The full list of Committee members is available on oireachtas.ie|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Caroline Spillane, Director General of Engineers Ireland and Cormac Bradley, Executive Board member, Engineers Ireland

Specific Details: Request for meeting to discuss the potential for Revolut to assist with delivery and measurement of planned stimulus packages for business affected by Covid-19 in a manner which would be simple and easy to use for consumers for the benefit of the economy, given the extent to which proposed functionality of Stay&Spend mirrors existing functionality within the Revolut App and our ability to create 'virtual cards' limited by Merchant Category Code to target spending at specific business types.
DPOs Lobbied: Damien English|Minister of State|Department of Housing, Planning and Local Government::Michael McGrath|Minister|Department of Public Expenditure and Reform::Pat Casey|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Request for meeting to discuss the potential for Revolut to assist with delivery and measurement of planned stimulus packages for business affected by Covid-19 in a manner which would be simple and easy to use for consumers for the benefit of the economy, given the extent to which proposed functionality of Stay&Spend mirrors existing functionality within the Revolut App and our ability to create 'virtual cards' limited by Merchant Category Code to target spending at specific business types.
Intended Results: Arrange a meeting with officials to discuss the potential for Revolut to assist in the delivery and measurement of stimulus packages for business affected by Covid-19 in a manner which would by simple and easy to use for consumers and having the potential to impact consumer spending in a manner which would benefit the economy.

Specific Details: Meeting with Senator Pat Casey
Subject Matter: Meeting with Senator Pat Casey
Intended Results: Meeting with  Senator Casey to discuss his views on potential for Arklow/Eastern region and the merit of key business stakeholders forming a strategic network.  SSE Renewables also updated the Senator on the wider SSER pipeline and on our views on the implementation of the Government's recently published policy framework on Phase 2 offshore wind development, including the need for broad DMAPS and the need for more ambition on the deployment of technology, including fixed bottom technologies.

Specific Details: Briefing on SSE Renewable projects.
Subject Matter: Briefing on SSE Renewable projects.
Intended Results:
Briefing by SSE Renewables to provide an update on the company’s activities.
SSE advocated for a requirement that offshore projects should have planning permission before competing in an ORESS auction, and for the development of a Hydrogen Strategy.         
Discussed through opportunities presented by interconnection, risk to supply chain from slow pace of the process.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Barry Kilcline, Kaj Christiansen, Deirdre Keogh, Brendan Dillon
